page.title: 04BICESTER'S LOCAL TRADITIONS.
page.content: CUSTOMS: Many customs are associated with the area,perhaps the most famous is the hunt.Bicester and Warden Hill Hunt holds an annual point-to-point and organises trials and horseshows.The Boxing Day Meet on the Market Square attracts many vistors.The hunters wear traditional red coats and drink punch before setting off to the sound of the hunting horn. TWINNING: In 1981 Bicester was twinned with Neunkirchen Seelscheid,Germany. Yearly exchanges take place between the two towns and civil ceremonies are held. DANCING: There are many local Morris dance groups.They regularly perform out side pubs and in the streets of the town during the summer months.
